title: setValue in microtask jumps the cursor to the end
body:
**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**
Not sure)

**What is the current behavior?**
1. I have a controlled component
```js
const Input = () => {
  const [val, setVal] = useState('')

  return <input value={val} onChange={(e) => {
    const { value } = e.target

    setValue(value)
  }} />
}
```

2. I type `foo`
3. I move the cursor to `f^oo`
4. I type `b`
5. I get `fb^oo` – that's okay.

I have another component:

```js
const Input = () => {
  const [val, setVal] = useState('')

  return <input value={val} onChange={(e) => {
    const { value } = e.target

    Promise.resolve().then(() => setValue(value))
  }} />
}
```
Do the same things 2-4.
5. I get `fboo^` – the cursor jumps to the end. Why?)

I understand why that happens when the value is formatted in some custom way – React just don't know how to handle cursor position properly.
https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/955#issuecomment-160826950

But why React does not handle the cursor position when I call setVal asynchronous (in the microtask)?

Probably there are good reasons for that – just name them then)

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**
react@16.8.3, chrome.
